availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. Talbott (Caldwell County, Kentucky, police judge)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, police judge. Kentucky native. Married to Sally B. Jacobs Talbott in Christian County, Kentucky, on December 16, 1822. Father of John C. Talbott and Henry Talbott. Married to Eliza Finley Talbott in Christian County on October 25, 1836. Father of Catharine E. Talbott. Resident in Christian County in 1830. Owned three enslaved persons in Christian County in 1830. Engaged in manufacture and trades in Christian County in 1840. Owned four enslaved persons in Christian County in 1840. Farmer in Christian County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Christian County in 1850. Police judge in Caldwell County in 1860.
